Some of the popular job board apps that offer networking opportunities for job seekers include:

1. LinkedIn: LinkedIn is one of the largest professional networking platforms and is widely used for job search and career development. In addition to job listings, LinkedIn offers a range of networking features, including professional communities, discussion forums, career events, and mentorship programs.
2. Glassdoor: Glassdoor is a job board that offers job listings and company reviews, as well as a range of career resources, including salary data and interview preparation resources. Glassdoor also has a "Insider Insights" section where employees can anonymously share information about their companies, including company culture, benefits, and work-life balance.
3. Indeed: Indeed is one of the largest job boards and offers job listings, as well as company reviews and salary data. Indeed also has a "Questions & Reviews" section where job seekers can ask and answer questions about companies and interview processes.
4. Monster: Monster is one of the oldest job boards and offers job listings, as well as a range of career resources, including resume building tools, career advice, and salary data.
5. ZipRecruiter: ZipRecruiter is a job board that offers job listings, as well as a range of tools and resources for job seekers, including interview preparation resources and salary data. ZipRecruiter also has a "Job Seeker Resources" section where job seekers can access articles and information on a range of career topics.

These are just a few examples of job board apps that offer networking opportunities and other career resources for job seekers. The key is to provide job seekers with access to a wide range of resources and tools that can help them advance their careers and connect with other professionals in their field.
